data.title: Horrible service in paid parking lot
data.text:
I was going to the DoubleTree for an event and accidentally went to the wrong one in Downtown Wilmington. (There are two in the area. The other one is better.) I had to pull into the parking lot to turn around and the guards there refused to let me leave without paying them for an hour first. I was there only long enough to make a u-turn and they basically extorted $3 from me for parking. The parking machines were broken, so I couldn't use a credit card and I didn't have any cash on me because the DoubleTree I was supposed to be going to said it had free parking. I was already late, so I didn't have time to make a fuss or run around looking for an ATM, so I had to search my vehicle until I could find enough spare change to get them to let me out of the parking lot. 

It's not about the money. I can afford $3. It's about the rudeness, the selfishness, the humiliation, the inconvenience, and the total lack of customer service. I was basically lost in Delaware and rather than showing an ounce of concern for me as a customer, the hotel parking staff took advantage of that just to make a $3 profit. 

The staff at the other DoubleTree seemed much nicer and they had free parking, but because of this experience, it's unlikely that I'll ever be staying at one of their hotels in the future. I work too hard for my money to give it to people who show no concern at all for the customers who keep them employed.

data.title: Horrible Experience Ever
data.text:
I usually start with the good points...there were NONE!  Poor check in...after waiting 10 minutes for a breakfast coupon, I gave up. Halls and room are worn and dingy.  Shower ceiling repaired but never painted. (724) Stain on towel. No room upgrade offered to a Diamond member.  No hot water in morning at 7:30 a.m.  Waited 10 minutes for water temp to change.  No luck. I told front desk and got NO satisfaction.  Breakfast bar at 8:45 am was sparse and most food was dried out and never refreshed since opening.

Would never stay again.  Bad for the brand.
Do not bother sending a canned response or excuse.

data.title: Downtown
data.text: Good location - good hotel provided transportation. Did not have to take car out of garage. Room and facilities clean and comfortable. Breakfast OK.  Did not know we could order from menu but otherwise it was very good.

data.title: not so clean
data.text: We recently went to a wedding at this Hotel and decided to stay the night.  The wedding was great and the accomadations and food surrounding that event.  The bathroom was dirty and some kind of film on tub and the floor was dirty.  The breakfast  in the hotel was less than average.

data.title: DoubleTree-Wilmington
data.text: The staff was very nice, helpful and attentive.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The beds were comfortable.  I did not care for the 'breakfast buffet', the breakfast food was not good and it stays the same every day.  It seems as though the employee-staff was cut down and it was not enough people working causing the few to do extra duty.  The front desk check in was very slow and only one person.  Long lines at times.

data.title: Dirty sheets
data.text: My sheets were never changed, hair and other particles on sheets. Otherwise, nice hotel would recommend. Bar cafe food very good. Staff friendly, courteous. Location, quiet, comfort beds other than sheets not clean. Pool nice

data.title: My Trip Wasn't Great - but the Double Tree WAS :)
data.text: The intention for my trip was to wrap up business in Northern Delaware - where my son and I used to live.  Now living in Cocoa, I took the train (avoiding planes for now) and researched the hotel closest to the Wilmington Amtrak station - which is Double Tree.  Upon arriving, I called the hotel to ask if they had shuttle service.  They most certainly do - and the amazing Mark arrived to pick me up.  Promptly.  He's a charming, fascinating man who knows the city's history very well.  I had four more journeys with Mark while staying with the hotel - and each one was a delight.  He's a credit to the company!  Also - I need to mention Megan at the front desk.  When I perused my room for the first time, I was impressed with the elegant simplicity of the layout.  Since I am now a "rewards" member, I was on the floor that caters to them.  I had a small problem which was instantly rectified by Megan - and she proceeded to show me kindness and thoughtfulness consistently throughout my visit.  On top of WONDERFUL servers in their dining room - one, a Mom of five who couldn't have been sweeter - I received a letter from an Executive at Double Tree.  She thanked me for staying at her hotel and asked how they could do better.  Guess what?  They can't.  They're already THERE!  I had a terrible time getting business done while I'm Wilmington (lesson learned: drop Wells Fargo immediately) - but at least I've discovered where I am going to stay from this time forward.  My Dad taught me the hard truth about Customer Service.  Double Tree displays it, Dad style :)

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your thoughtful and engaging review! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us, and delighted to be your hotel of choice for travel to Wilmington. I was overjoyed (but not surprised!) to read your feedback about Mark and Megan. They are both superstars, and embody the service we strive for at the DoubleTree. I truly appreciate you taking the time to provide your feedback here, and look forward to the next opportunity to welcome you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: One night stay at the Double Tree Hilton Hotel in Wilmington DE
data.text: Check in was quick even though it was an Election evening.  The receptionist was very cordial and welcomed with a great smile. Room was spacious and clean. There was coffee maker but no tea. and I missed the tea :) all else was  A OK

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking a moment to review your stay with us on Trip Advisor, Danyal! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your visit, and appreciate the feedback. I am terribly sorry that we missed your tea- I will certainly address this with our housekeeping team. Please do not hesitate to contact us in the future if there is anything we can do to make your visit more comfortable. Thank you again, we hope to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Okay
data.text: Not the best or the worse place. Front desk employee gave me the wrong room key but was somewhat apologetic. Air conditioner was so load I could barely sleep. Located centrally in the City so that is a very big plus. All in all it was just okay. PS - Wilmington is a pretty cool place!

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Rhett, thank you for your review. We apologize that your recent visit was not exceptional one, but appreciate your feedback. We hope to make your next visit exemplary!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable and Pleasant Employees
data.text: Great experience, was there for an event and room was very comfortable, enjoyed the work out room and even had a chance to relax in the pool. An employee, Harry Saunders was so professional and helpful not only to us but we watched how he helped out some of the older customers with their items.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review Tanya! We're so happy that you enjoyed your recent visit, and appreciate your recognition of Harry. I was glad to share your feedback with him and the rest of the team. We hope to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The front desk does not return the calls. The properties left by guests end up nowhere!
data.text: My husband stayed in this hotel twice in October. Once for a period of one week and second time for three days. He left two ties( one very expensive one, purchased in France), shampoo and conditioners in the room. He left the hotel went to court and directly to airport. There was no other stop. He tried to contact the hotel and ask about the tie. He was very unsuccessful the get any results. He could not get connected to the housekeeping and the front desk people would not return the calls. Eventually after calling twice and numerous emails, they denied the there was any tie turned in to their lost and found! It seems to me that they have a MAJOR trustworthiness housekeeping issues on top oft badly managed guest relation services. We will never stay at any Doubletree hotel again..

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We were and are truly sorry to hear about this experience. After personally getting involved in the situation with your husband's missing ties, and speaking to everyone involved, it was clear that no neckties were found in that guestroom back in October. We understand how important these ties must have been to both you and your husband, and we are sorry that we were not able to locate them. Regardless, our team is comprised of individuals whom I trust implicitly, and I do not believe there to have been any malicious intent here. We appreciate your feedback, and sorry that you will no longer be doing business with DoubleTree.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quite nice, but not as good as some of this brand
data.text: This is a reasonably modern hotel with parking underneath. We had a friendly welcome and a nice room with all the usual amenities. Perhaps we have been spoilt by other Doubletree hotels, but we thought that the décor was perhaps a little more tired than we are used to. We thought (perhaps unfairly) that the area was a little dodgy, so we used the hotel free shuttle to take us to dinner. Great service from a charming driver. Car park underneath charge $12 for overnight parking.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking a moment to review your recent stay. We're glad that you enjoyed your visit, but sorry to hear that the experience wasn't exceptional. We appreciate the feedback, and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: We were there on points. The room was adequate but noisy. We were given a free breakfast which we were not expecting. The hotel charged extra for parking. We hope the next doubletree we go to will be a bit more up to date.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Harvey, thank you for taking a moment to review your visit with us on Trip Advisor. We apologize that you did not find your stay with us to be an exceptional one, but appreciate your feedback. We apologize for any inconvenience over the parking fee, but this is a charge from the city to park in a city owned parking garage, and not collected by the hotel. Thank you again for your time and business, we hope you have a wonderful weekend!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Stay! Excellent Customer Service
data.text: Staff was excellent, they went above and beyond for us! Room was spotless and spacious. Restaurant was very good too. Shuttle service was an added bonus and very easy to use. We were very comfortable.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review, Julie! We're delighted that you enjoyed your recent visit, and hope to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: AMAZING start, but terrible finish
data.text: The hotel itself is nice and the two ladies at the lobby check-in were some of the nicest Hilton employees I've ever met in my life. So very pleasant and such great personalities! Lovely to check-in at the hotel with having their smiling faces and willingness to do anything to make my stay enjoyable. I told them that I was only there for a few hours and had to wake up early for a meeting. As a Diamond member, they were on a mission to make sure those few hours were great. Well when I woke up this morning, that all changed unfortunately because of one bad apple - I'm not a believer that one person should ruin my rating, but her unprofessional attitude and the way she just made me feel so uncomfortable needs to be addressed. I received a voucher for a free breakfast and asked her if I could get a to-go box because I was a little rushed for time and needed to eat on the go. It was 6:30am and no one was in the restaurant. She then scolded me and asked why I needed it to go and rolled her eyes at me and denied my request. I continued to be nice and EVEN apologized that my simple request got her so mad but she remained so very mean and belittled me. Never in my life, especially never at a Hilton resort - have I ever been so badly treated. She then said "fine but what do you want" - I told her I just wanted eggs to go and she went back to get me silverware. I was so upset that when she turned away, I literally walked right out very upset because I didn't want to hear what she was going to say next. I completely lost my appetite and didn't want to be around this negativity. Very, very disappointing and NOT a good representation of Hilton customer service. Your hotel is great, your staff is solid - but this lady needs customer service skills, or even just a smile.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent visit. While I am thrilled to read about the wonderful service and warm welcome you received from our team at the Front Desk, I am so disappointed to hear about the unacceptable service you received in the restaurant at breakfast. I will personally follow up with our Restaurant Manager for her review, and can only apologize for the disappointing end to an otherwise positive visit. I assure you this is not indicative of the excellent service we strive for here at the DoubleTree, and these comments will be addressed.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The stay was excellent. The staff was friendly and courteous.
data.text: the place was clean . The staff was very knowledgable. Price for the area was great. There was plenty to do in the area. The continental breakfast was really good. Wireless internet was free for Hilton honors members and worked great.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Steve- thank you for your review! We're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us, and appreciate the thoughtful feedback. We're glad that you had everything you needed, and hope to have the chance to welcome you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Old hotel
data.text: Would never stay at this hotel again... Bug found, can't prove it but the only hotel I stayed in and had bite mark. Received call and was hung up on, not a good experience. The qualit of the Hilton is going down.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review your visit with us on Trip Advisor. We're terribly sorry that you were disappointed with your recent stay, but do appreciate the feedback. I want to reiterate once again that we had your guestroom fully inspected and cleared by our pest control company, and found absolutely no evidence of such an issue. We apologize for any inconvenience or discomfort you endured, and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future for an exceptional experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean, Comfy, Perfect Location for Theater
data.text:
We bought tickets to see a play at the Grand Opera House and wanted a nice place to stay overnight. The Double Tree was perfect. It is literally across the street from the theater, so the location couldn't be better. The hotel offers a shuttle so we were able to park and leave our car. Harry, the shuttle driver, took us to our restaurant and picked us up in plenty of time to make our 8 pm curtain. That convenience alone was worth the price of admission. 

At check in we were offered delicious cookies.The front desk folks were hospitable and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The pillows were amazingly comfortable, and the bed was too. If we return to Wilmington for any reason, we'd definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: That you for reviewing your stay with us! We're absolutely thrilled that you enjoyed your recent visit with us. We appreciate your kind words about Harry and the rest of our team, and hope to see you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: You should stay
data.text: This hotel is a excellent hotel for couples and family. The hotel was neat and clean. Staff was nice they had good customer service. They have nice size rooms. I love this hotel. I will be staying again.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review, Seberina! We're delighted that you enjoyed your recent stay, and hope to welcome you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfort and convenience
data.text:
My husband & I stayed several nights at Doubletree Downtown Wilmington earlier this month. We stayed in a well appointed room, enjoyed an array of choices at breakfast, and appreciated being downtown and well situated to reach different parts of the city.  The fitness room was equipped with new, well functioning machines. 

One must pay for parking (minimum $12 per night) because Hilton does not own or control the parking spaces. 

Our son decided to visit and we needed a second room. Hilton accommodated us but the cost was $185, a lot more money per night than the web showed that an overnight stay was being advertised for.  When I questioned the desk on that, I was told that the cheaper rooms were not available.  

Maybe that was so. But on a Friday night, one would have expected that the exit of some business travelers would have freed up rooms, not make availability tighter.

owner_response.author: Lauren P, Director of Rooms at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Downtown Wilmington - Legal District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking a moment to review your visit! We're glad that you enjoyed your stay, and appreciate your feedback. While our rates and availability change constantly depending on the date, and what specific groups are staying with us, we apologize if you felt the value for the additional room did not match your original. We appreciate the feedback, and hope to welcome you back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
